Data: Australia have been pretty strong in their last two ODIs, following West Indies' win in the Twenty20 which seems a while ago. So it's a must-win situation for the home side, stay with us for the toss news soon.
Lee to Gayle, no run Lee starts over the wicket and fires through to the keeper, the batsman shouldering arms first up
Lee to Gayle, 1 run on a length, on the pads, turned to fine leg
Lee to Marshall, no run oh! Good ball, some swing away, rising well from the length and Marshall is immediately forced to leave it
Lee to Marshall, 1 wide down the legs, and Lee just strays too far with the effort, Marshall is quick to jump into an extravagant leave
Lee to Marshall, no run Lee corrects immediately, with a straight one which is just defended away without too much troble
Lee to Marshall, 1 run tucked off the legs out to midwicket, Marshall off the mark now
Lee to Gayle, no run fires through quite tightly across him, the batsman shoulders arms
Bracken to Marshall, 1 leg bye some swing back in to the batsman, half-appeal, a bit of ball-watching going on but Gayle calls the quick single to the covers
Bracken to Gayle, no run some swing away, the batsman straightens behind it, it moves away, takes the edge but bounces well in front fo the slips
Bracken to Gayle, no run outside off, some nice shape away and the batsman is quick on to the back foot, and to leave it, too. No run
Bracken to Gayle, no run again moving away from Gayle who lets it go through
Bracken to Gayle, no run left alone again, still that good shape and Gayle once more lets it go
Lee to Marshall, no run fullish, on the off and middle stump line, shaping away a touch, squeezed of the outer edge to covers
Lee to Marshall, no run gets across to a length delivery outside off and is hit on the pad. Lee asks the question. Hit outside off.
Lee to Marshall, no run short of length, coming in towards middle and leg, dabbed to the on side
Lee to Marshall, no run
Lee to Marshall, no run just outside off stump, full in length, covers the off stump and shoulders arms
Lee to Marshall, no run a tad outside off stump, trying to tempt him into a loose drive but he resists and again lets it go past him
Bracken to Gayle, no run curving away from Gayle who lets it go through to the 'keeper
Bracken to Gayle, no run length delivery around the off stump, pushed to the off side
Bracken to Gayle, 1 run fuller, moves away at the last minute, Gayle is struck at the crease, opens the bat-face to adjust to the swing and runs it down to wide third man
Bracken to Marshall, no run shaping in towards middle and leg, beats the waft and it runs off the pad
Bracken to Marshall, no run again on the middle and leg line, coming in and Xavier plants his front pad across, tries to get his bat around it and the ball rolls of the pad to the on side
Bracken to Marshall, no run moves this one across the batsman, left alone
Lee to Gayle, no run lands on a length around the off stump and moves away, left alone by Gayle
Lee to Gayle, no run on the off stump line, pushed to covers

Lee to Gayle, no run beaten outside off. It cut across outside off stump, Gayle plants his front leg forward, then withdraws it, tries to push back and wastes valuable time in the process and in the end, tries to jab it but makes no contact
Lee to Gayle, FOUR runs Gayle breaks free with a feisty cut shot. Short and not all that wide, he moved back and across and got into a nice position
Lee to Gayle, no run just outside off stump, Gayle covers the off stump and lets it sail through to the 'keeper

Lee to Gayle, no run lands on a length on the same spot as the last ball but instead of shaping away, it straightens and Gayle had already decided to let it go and it bounces over the off stump and brushes the pad en route to the keeper
Bracken to Marshall, no run
Bracken to Marshall, no run lands it outside off stump, curves in a touch, Xavier gets across to push it cautiously to the off side

Bracken to Marshall, 1 run almost caught at covers by the diving Symonds. It was a full toss that swung in towards middle and leg, Xavier tried to swat it through midwicket and got the leading edge. Symonds dived full stretch but it fell short of him
Bracken to Gayle, no run
Bracken to Gayle, no run on the off stump line, Gayle gets across to defend to the off side
Bracken to Gayle, no run on the off and middle line, Gayle leans forward to defend the delivery that straightened this time
Lee to Marshall, no run kicks up from short of length, on the middle stump line, fended to the on side
Lee to Marshall, no run leaves it alone outside off stump
Lee to Marshall, no run swinging delivery full and well outside off stump, the swing started a tad too early in the trajectory and Xavier didn't have much problem in letting that one go through
Lee to Marshall, no run hits the deck short of length, holds its line outside off stump, Xavier shoulders arms
Lee to Marshall, (no ball) full in length, around the off stump and Xavier gets across to defend . Xavier stands just outside the crease, taps his bat on the crease as he awaits the bowler

Lee to Marshall, no run And very strange. Xavier doesn't even try to hit the free hit delivery. Compact defensive stroke. Lee is bemused and signals to Xavier the free hit signal and smiles. Gayle goes across to have a chat. I guess he didn't see the signal of the no-ball and free hit.
Lee to Marshall, no run on the middle and leg, dabbed to leg side
Bracken to Gayle, no run not all that short, around the off stump line, Gayle moved his back leg outside off, opened his stance and in the end, stabbed it to the off side

Bracken to Gayle, 2 runs again that exaggerated foot movement. The back leg goes back and across and lands just outside off stump, he opens his stance and then cuts a length delivery through cover point
Bracken to Gayle, no run he has decided to go for his shots. Again that back and across movement and he cuts a length delivery to covers

Bracken to Gayle, SIX runs Meaty blow as Gayle goes down town. He walked down the track and scythed a full length delivery over long-off. He just stood there and admired the stroke. Now a long-off is in place
Bracken to Gayle, no run on the middle stump line and Gayle defends back along the track
Bracken to Gayle, no run drags back the length and moves it outside off stump, Gayle lets it fly past him
Lee to Marshall, no run hurls it full outside off stump and Xavier goes hard at his off drive and mistimes it towards mid-off

Lee to Marshall, no run the surprise bouncer almost works. Xavier tried to press back but the ball got big on him quickly and he fended it and it popped up off the leading edge in front of him. Lee can't reach it
Lee to Marshall, (no ball) outside the off stump and left alone. Free hit next ball and Gayle walks across to let him know! Just making sure his young opener is aware.
Lee to Marshall, FOUR runs X-Man breaks free. He moved outside leg stump and drills a full pitched delivery inside-out through wide mid-off.
Lee to Marshall, FOUR runs full again and Xavier skips down the track and lofts it just over the jumping Shane Watson at mid-on
Lee to Marshall, no run leans forward to push it back down the track
Lee to Marshall, no run hits the deck on a length and outside off stump, left alone
Johnson to Gayle, FOUR runs Blasted over midwicket. He moves right back to a full delivery, predetermined movement - he pressed back and opened his stance up - and whipped it over midwicket.
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run stays at his position and drives another full delivery hard to right of mid-on where a diving stop is made
Johnson to Marshall, no run on the leg and middle line, off a length, Xavier Marshall tries to turn it to square leg, misses and it runs off the pad to the on side
Johnson to Marshall, no run full pitched on the middle, driven to mid-on
Johnson to Marshall, FOUR runs X-man dances down the track. The ball is pushed across him. He brings his bat down and slices it over covers.
Johnson to Marshall, no run short of length, coming into him and he takes out the bottom hand and tries to jab it to the leg side and it rolls off the pad
Hopes to Gayle, no run on the off and middle line, steered to backward point
Hopes to Gayle, FOUR runs slightly short of length and Gayle clears the front leg and pulls it through wide midwicket
Hopes to Gayle, 1 run again a touch short in length, another pull but this time he drags it towards deep square leg
Hopes to Marshall, 1 run short in length, outside off stump, guided through cover point

Hopes to Gayle, FOUR runs Simple technique from Gayle. The back leg goes back and across, the front leg is pressed outside leg and from that open stance he swings a short-of-length delivery to wide midwicket boundary. One bounce and over the ropes.
Hopes to Gayle, no run lands on the leg stump line and goes down leg, gathered by the 'keeper
Johnson to Marshall, no run crispy cover drive but Roy (Symonds) dives to his at right at covers to make a fine stop.
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run rotates the strike back to Gayle with a slash to Lee at third man
Johnson to Gayle, 1 wide down the leg side and Ronchi makes a diving stop
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run just outside off stump, dabbed to backward point
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run full in length, on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
Johnson to Gayle, no run outside the off stump and left alone
Johnson to Gayle, no run beaten outside off stump, Delivered with a slightly round-arm action and slinged across in the zone outside off, Gayle pushed inside the line
Hopes to Marshall, 1 run just outside off stump, chopped to short third man region
Hopes to Gayle, SIX runs slightly short in length and Gayle went for the pull towards wide midwicket but it flew towards wide long-on but cleared the fielder
Hopes to Gayle, no run leans forward to push to the on side
Hopes to Gayle, 1 run on a length, around middle stump, slogged to deep square leg
Hopes to Marshall, no run gets forward to defend a length delivery to covers
Hopes to Marshall, 1 run leans forward to jab a length delivery to the off side for a single

Johnson to Marshall, no run dropped by Michael Clarke Xavier Marshall had charged down the track and had a heave but could only got a top edge, straight up. Johnson ran towards it, Clarke came rushing from point and Johnson let his team-mate to try catching that. But Clarke misjudged it completel
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run dabbed through to third man
Johnson to Gayle, no run
Johnson to Gayle, no run fullish, on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run
Johnson to Marshall, 1 leg bye on the leg stump line, runs off the pad to short fine leg region
Hopes to Marshall, 1 run just outside off stump, chopped to left of backward point for a quick single. Marshall was ball watching but managed to scamper home.
Hopes to Gayle, no run on the leg and middle, turned to short fine leg where Johnson fields
Hopes to Gayle, 1 run works a similar delivery past square leg
Hopes to Marshall, no run shout for lbw as Marshall pushes forward to defend. He was struck in front of middle and leg and the hawk eye suggests it would have hit the top of leg
Hopes to Marshall, no run leans forward to push a delivery on off and middle to covers
Hopes to Marshall, 2 runs similar delivery and this time Xavier Marshall mistimes a drive over the bowler's head and will pick up couple of runs
Johnson to Gayle, no run leans forward to defend a length delivery around the off stump
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run turned to the on side for a quick single
Johnson to Marshall, no run outside the off stump, left alone
Johnson to Marshall, no run goes for the yorker, lands on the crease on the middle and leg line, dug out to the on side
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run lifting delivery on the off stump line, takes the bottom hand off the handle, taps it towards gully for a single
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run steered to wide third man for a single
Symonds to Gayle, no run stretches forward to jab it off bat and pad to the off side.
Symonds to Gayle, no run on the middle and leg, dabbed to the on side
Symonds to Gayle, no run pushes to covers
Symonds to Gayle, no run
Symonds to Gayle, FOUR runs Gayle drills a full pitched delivery on the middle to right of long-on
Symonds to Gayle, SIX runs Monster hit. He thrust his front foot out and swung a full delivery on leg and middle to wide long-on stands. 50 up for the captain.
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run full pitched outside off stump, driven to extra cover
Johnson to Gayle, 1 run turned to Lee at long leg for another single. The throw was flat, fast and on top of the stumps.
Johnson to Marshall, 2 runs on the leg side, turned to fine leg for couple of runs

Johnson to Marshall, OUT Gayle is run out. Oh what a way to go.Marshall had driven a fullish delivery back down the track and the lunging Johnson had got a hand on it and it went on to break the stumps and Gayle couldn't get back into the crease in time. He was in murderous mood but has to go bac
Johnson to Marshall, no run leans forward to push a full delivery to the on side
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run gets behind the line of a length delivery on the middle and leg and works it to midwicket
Watson to Marshall, no run starts off with a delivery well outside the off stump, the batsman tries to cut but can't connect
Watson to Marshall, no run stays back to punch a length delivery around off to mid-off
Watson to Marshall, no run swing and a miss. Short in length, outside off and Marshall tried to cut it hard but the bat went underneath the ball
Watson to Marshall, 1 run gets back and across this time and chops it down to third man for a single
Watson to Sarwan, no run on a length, just outside off stump, Sarwan stabs it close on the off side and Watson rushes through to pick the ball up
Watson to Sarwan, no run outside the off stump line, left alone
Johnson to Marshall, no run just outside the off stump, Marshall is beside the line, tries to run it down to third man and is beaten
Johnson to Marshall, FOUR runs He cleared his front foot and flat-batted a short-of-length delivery over mid-off. Confident and aggressive
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run turned to the leg side for a single
Johnson to Sarwan, 1 wide bangs it short and it sails down leg
Johnson to Sarwan, 1 wide fuller but again down leg. Asad Rauf extends his arms
Johnson to Sarwan, 1 run clipped to long leg for a single
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run leans forward to drive pleasingly to right of mid-off
Johnson to Sarwan, 1 run full length delivery, pushed towards mid-off for a quick single
Watson to Sarwan, 1 run slower one on the middle and leg, turned to square leg
Watson to Chanderpaul, 5 wide wide down the leg side and it runs away to the boundary
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run worked to left of midwicket for a single
Watson to Sarwan, no run gets behind the line of a length delivery and pushes it cautiously to the off side
Watson to Sarwan, no run fuller, on the middle and off line, pushed to the off side
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run stretches across to flick a delivery from outside off to midwicket

Clarke to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs The falling sweep! Well not quite Kanhai but profitable. He stretched his foot out and slog swept a full delivery to deep backward square leg boundary and lost balance in doing so
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run played towards cover
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 3 runs another lofted sweep but this time it goes to deep midwicket region. He was trying to hit square but didn't middle it well.
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run gets forward to ping long-off
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run flighted full, driven back to the bowler
Watson to Sarwan, no run cutting in towards the off stump, steered to backward point
Watson to Sarwan, 1 run a tad slower , full in length, outside off, cut to left of backward point
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run slanted across Chanders who lets it go in his typical fashion: the bat goes inside the line and towards mid-on
Watson to Chanderpaul, 3 runs leans forward to drive a full delivery well to the right of mid-off, Lee moves across and dives but lets it slip through his fingers
Watson to Sarwan, 1 run short of length, on the middle and leg, that length allows Sarwan to wrist it behind square leg
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run outside off stump, left alone
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run leans forward to drive a ball on the middle to long-off
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 1 run outside off, steered towards short third man region for a single
Clarke to Sarwan, no run full and down leg, swept to short fine leg.
Clarke to Sarwan, no run slower through the air, Sarwan waits before cutting it late to short third man
Clarke to Sarwan, no run flatter, a tad quicker, on the off, chopped to short third man again
Clarke to Sarwan, no run fuller, mistimes a drive back to the bowler
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run length delivery outside off, defended to the off side
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run leans forward to drive to mid-off
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run outside off, angling away, he gets forward to tap it to Symonds at extra cover
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run slower one, full, driven to covers
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run around the off stump line, moving away and Chanders gets across to push it to cover point. Can't get that single he wants
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run full pitched just outside off stump, driven to long-off for a single
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run floated outside off, from over the sticks, driven to covers
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run on a length, just outside off, tapped to the leg side, they think about a single but change their mind as Ronchi rushes across
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run tries to paddle a delivery outside off and gloves it on to his helmet.
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 1 run connects with the paddle shot this time and will get a single to fine leg
Clarke to Sarwan, no run arm-ball on the off stump line, dabbed to backward point
Clarke to Sarwan, 2 runs stretches across to take a flighted delivery on the full and drives to right of sweeper cover where a diving stop is made
Watson to Chanderpaul, FOUR runs thrust his front foot out and creamed a full pitched delivery to the right of the umpire who jumps to his left
Watson to Chanderpaul, 2 runs on the middle, wristed to deep backward square leg for couple of runs
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run Chanders tried to swing a length delivery from outside off over midwicket and misses. Sarwan walks over to have a chat.
Watson to Chanderpaul, no run on the off stump line, guided to point
Watson to Chanderpaul, 2 runs outside off stump and square driven to deep backward point region where Hussey makes a sliding stop near the ropes to save two runs
Watson to Chanderpaul, 1 run pushed to extra cover for a single
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 1 run short of length, outside off, cut to right of deep point region
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run steps down the track and taps a full length delivery to square leg
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run outside the off stump, Chanderpaul tries to paddle it but mistimes it close on the leg side and Ronchi goes across to pick up the ball
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run leans across to defend to covers
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run fuller, on the off stump line, driven to right of Clarke who lunges to make the stop
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run a tad quicker, fuller and Chanderpaul jabs it to the off side
Symonds to Sarwan, no run floated outside off, driven to covers
Symonds to Sarwan, FOUR runs lovely inside-out drive past the extra-cover fielder. He had driven the previous delivery uppishly and straight to the fielder but not this time
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run driven to deep cover for a single
Symonds to Chanderpaul, no run floated on the off, driven to covers
Symonds to Chanderpaul, no run slower in the air, on the middle, turned to midwicket
Symonds to Chanderpaul, 1 run leans forward to retain the strike with a single to long-off
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run leans to work a full delivery to midwicket
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 2 runs stretches across to drive to left of sweeper cover
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 1 run full and on the off stump line, whipped to deep midwicket
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run leans forward to drive a full delivery outside off to deep cover
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run just outside off, tapped to the on side of the track

Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run goes back to cut to short third man. He needs to take singles more frequently, has ended up pushing straight to covers and midwicket on a few occasions. But he has corrected the equation with a few boundary hits.
Symonds to Sarwan, no run flighted full, driven hard to covers
Symonds to Sarwan, no run just outside off stump and Sarwan tries to play a late cut but misses
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run gets forward to on drive to long-on for a single
Symonds to Chanderpaul, no run driven inside-out with the turn to covers
Symonds to Chanderpaul, 1 run low full toss, driven to Hussey at deep cover
Symonds to Sarwan, FOUR runs Shot boss! He drove a flighted delivery inside-out over extra cover. Eye-catching stroke
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run leans forward to push to the off side
Clarke to Chanderpaul, 1 run short of length, cut to deep point
Clarke to Sarwan, 2 runs leans forward to whip a full delivery to deep midwicket region
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run and this time down to long-off for a single
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run gets forward to tap it back to the bowler
Clarke to Chanderpaul, no run on the off and middle, squeezed to covers
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run driven to long-on for another single
Symonds to Chanderpaul, 1 run on the middle and leg, Chanderpaul waits for it to turn before nudging it behind square leg
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run another single to long-on.
Symonds to Chanderpaul, 1 run drives past the diving Symonds to long-off
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run full in length, on the off stump line, Sarwan opened the bat face and guided it to left of short third man.
Symonds to Chanderpaul, OUT Ronchi snaps another good catch. Chanderpaul edged the intended cut shot and Ronchi managed to take it on the second attempt.
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run on the middle stump line, full, worked behind square leg
Clarke to Bravo, 1 run comes down the track and drives a full toss to long-on. He then practises hitting it towards midwicket
Clarke to Sarwan, no run on the middle, worked to midwicket
Clarke to Sarwan, 1 run down the leg side, turned to backward square leg
Clarke to Bravo, no run quicker, flatter, full, defended down the track
Clarke to Bravo, no run comes in towards off and middle, chopped to cover point
Symonds to Sarwan, no run flighted full on the middle, driven to covers
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run steps down the track and drives past the diving Symonds to long-off
Symonds to Bravo, 1 run on the leg and middle line, swept to right of long leg
Symonds to Sarwan, 1 run quicker, on the middle and leg line again, Sarwan goes back to work it behind square leg
Symonds to Bravo, no run on the off stump line, turning in, dabbed to the on side
Symonds to Bravo, 2 runs goes back to whip a delivery turning into middle stump to deep square leg region and by the time Bracken got across from long leg he would pick up two
Johnson to Sarwan, no run short of length, just outside off stump, steered to point
Johnson to Sarwan, no run shuffles across to the off stump, tries to work the ball on the off to leg side but can only get it down the track
Johnson to Sarwan, no run short in length, sitting up outside off, cut down to the ground and to point
Johnson to Sarwan, no run beaten as Sarwan gets squared up. It was delivered like a off break and it spat from middle line to outside off with bounce
Johnson to Fletcher, no run on the middle stump line, on a length, turned to the on side of the pitch
Lee to Ramdin, FOUR runs smashes a slower one to deep midwicket boundary
Lee to Ramdin, 1 run banged in short outside off stump, cut to third man
Lee to Sammy, OUT Wicket no 300 for Lee. It was the slower one and Sammy was early into the intended lofted shot, edged it towards short mid-off region, Lee called for it early and pouches it safely.
Lee to Ramdin, 1 run pushed towards extra cover for a quick single and had Symonds found the stumps, Ramdin would have been out
Lee to Powell, no run the slow bouncer, Powell was too early into the pull and Lee smiles and Powell too has a laugh about it
Lee to Powell, 1 run driven to mid-on for a single
Bracken to Powell, 1 run turns a length delivery to the leg side and they cross over for a single. Bracken hit the stumps at the non-striker's end but Powell was in
Bracken to Ramdin, no run moves outside leg and cuts to backward point
Bracken to Ramdin, OUT he moved outside leg, tried to cut a short of length delivery but it was the slower one and he ended up chopping it on to his stumps.
Bracken to Edwards, no run full and straight, pushed to the off side
Bracken to Edwards, no run cut across the batsman who is beaten on the forward prod
Bracken to Edwards, 1 run banged in short, fended towards short cover for a single
Symonds to Bravo, 1 run leans forward to push to cover point
Symonds to Fletcher, no run turns in towards the off stump, defended down the track
Symonds to Fletcher, 1 run goes back to work a delivery turning into middle behind square leg. The home boy gets a loud cheer from the crowd
Symonds to Bravo, 2 runs comes down the track and drives inside-out to left of long-off
Symonds to Bravo, no run full toss, surprised Bravo pushes it back to the bowler
Johnson to Fletcher, 1 wide wide down the leg side
Johnson to Fletcher, no run on the off and middle, jabbed to the off side
Johnson to Fletcher, FOUR runs short of length, outside off stump, Fletcher, the home boy, moves back and across and cuts neatly to deep backward point boundary. Elegant. Well timed.
Johnson to Fletcher, 1 run on the leg and middle, kicking up from short of length, turned to backward square leg
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run
Johnson to Fletcher, 1 leg bye on the legs, misses the flick shot, runs off the pad
Johnson to Ramdin, 1 run turned to square leg
Lee to Edwards, no run short and climbing outside off, tries to upper cut it but can't wood on leather
Lee to Edwards, FOUR runs picked up the slower one early, waited before lofting it straight down the ground
Lee to Edwards, 1 leg bye faster, on the middle and leg, Fidel was on the back foot expecting a bouncer, had a waft and will pick up a leg bye as the ball rolled to short fine leg

Lee to Powell, OUT Lee the footballer does the trick. Powell had dabbed a short of length delivery close on the off side, set off for the run, was sent back and he slipped. Meanwhile, Lee had rushed along and kicked it on to the stumps. A neat little left footer.
Lee to Benn, no run outside the off stump, another slower one, swing and a miss
Lee to Benn, no run another swing across the line and the ball bounces over the stumps
Bracken to Edwards, 1 run bouncer catches Fidel by surprise and he fends it off in an ungainly manner to short leg
Bracken to Benn, 1 run banged in short again, Benn takes his eyes of the ball but manages to connect with his swat-pull
Bracken to Edwards, no run Fidel moves outside leg and tries to swing a length delivery over midwicket but fails to connect
Bracken to Edwards, 1 run short-pitched delivery again, pushed towards short mid-off region for a quick single
Bracken to Benn, no run another swing and a miss.
Bracken to Benn, OUT Bracken terminates the West Indies innings with a yorker. Benn charged out, had a heave but missed.
Australia need 224 to win this game. West Indies started off well but were disappointing in the later half of the innings. Too many soft dismissals. Join us in a short while for the run chase.
Edwards to Marsh, no run good start. On target. Just outside off stump and Marsh is caught the crease, feet together and he searched for the ball outside off. beaten.
Edwards to Marsh, no run further outside off and Marsh lets this one go past him without any problem
Edwards to Marsh, no run again angling across Marsh but it lands outside off and so Marsh lets it fly past him
Edwards to Marsh, 1 wide tries to bring this one back in but slips down leg side.
Edwards to Marsh, no run back to the outside -off stump channel, left alone by Marsh

Edwards to Marsh, OUT Marsh is cleaned up by Fidel . It landed on a length around the off stump and curved in a touch, Marsh was looking to leave it, saw the straightening, tried to bring his bat down. Too late. Thin nick and it crashed into the off stump.
Edwards to Ponting, no run outside the off stump, left alone.
Powell to Watson, no run cuts in off short of length, on middle and leg, turned to square leg
Powell to Watson, no run leans forward to defend a length delivery on the off stump
Powell to Watson, no run homing in on the off stump, nudged down the track and Powell moves across to pick up the ball
Powell to Watson, no run cuts in from the good length, towards middle and leg, Watson tries to tuck it to the leg side but is struck on the thigh pad
Powell to Watson, no run fuller, on the off and middle, Watson flicks it to square leg, standing close
Powell to Watson, 2 runs turns a full delivery from middle and off to long leg
Edwards to Ponting, no run lands on a length on the middle, straightens, Ponting opens up his stance to defend it to the on side
Edwards to Ponting, no run rushing through the channel outside off stump, Ponting lunges forward to let it go past him
Edwards to Ponting, no run fuller, closer to the off stump, driven to covers.
Edwards to Ponting, 1 wide wide down the leg side
Edwards to Ponting, 1 run leans forward to push a full delivery outside off stump to wide third man
Edwards to Watson, 1 run on a length, around middle, dabbed behind square leg
Edwards to Ponting, no run leans forward to defend a length delivery outside off stump
Powell to Watson, no run short of length, again that front leg moves towards off and he defends down the track.
Powell to Watson, no run fullish, on the off stump, mistimes a drive to the leg side
Powell to Watson, no run defends a length delivery close on the off side, Ponting thinks there is a single in it, Watson, wisely, doesn't share the thought
Powell to Watson, no run banged in short of length, outside off stump, Watto shapes to pull but mistimes it to mid-on.
Powell to Watson, FOUR runs overpitched outside off and Watson drives past the bowler and to the right of mid-off
Powell to Watson, no run cutting in towards middle, Watson tries to play around the front pad, misses and is struck high on the thigh pad
Edwards to Ponting, 1 run well outside the off stump, reaches out for it to cut to wide third man
Edwards to Watson, no run outside the off stump, on a length, Watson bends his knee, tries to work it to third man but it runs off the face of the bat, along the ground, to right of second slip
Edwards to Watson, 1 run short in length, outside off stump, pushed to cover point for a quick single. Sammy with the throw and had he hit Ponting would have been run out
Edwards to Ponting, 2 runs drifts towards the pads, turned neatly to left of long leg
Edwards to Ponting, no run leans forward to drive with the full face of the bat to mid-off
Edwards to Ponting, FOUR runs gets forward and across and creams a full delivery through cover point
Powell to Watson, no run fires in a bouncer and Watson ducks
Powell to Watson, no run slower one outside off stump, full and defended to the off side
Powell to Watson, 1 run on a length, outside off stump, dabbed wide of slips

Powell to Ponting, FOUR runs full pitched outside off stump and Ponting eases it through wide mid-off. Two superbly struck boundaries from Ponting. Is the wheel beginning to turn for him? he has been in awful form recently
Powell to Ponting, no run cuts in of short of length, towards middle, clipped to square leg
Powell to Ponting, FOUR runs And he pings the wide midwicket boundary now. He leaned forward to pick up a full delivery over the on-side field
Edwards to Watson, FOUR runs short and on the off stump and Watson swivels of the front foot to pull it front of square leg
Edwards to Watson, 1 run fuller and well outside off stump, slashed to right of third man for a single
Edwards to Ponting, 3 runs swinging in to the leg and middle line and Ponting whips it through midwicket. He arrested the front foot movement, leaned across and wristed it away
Edwards to Watson, FOUR runs The runs are coming in a hurry now. Watto powers a full drive through extra cover
Edwards to Watson, no run full in length, straight on the middle, turned to square leg.
Edwards to Watson, no run slower one, full, driven to mid-on
Powell to Ponting, 1 run slower again, short of length, dabbed to third man
Powell to Watson, no run shout for lbw but was struck high. It came in from outside off, the bat came down outside the line and he was struck in front of middle and leg
Powell to Watson, 1 run leans forward to dab a length delivery to point
Powell to Ponting, no run full and on the middle, trying to trap him but Ponting makes sure his front leg is not pressed across too much and defends
Powell to Ponting, no run short in length, coming in, turned to midwicket
Powell to Ponting, no run the slow bouncer - I had seen quite a few of them in the IPL - Ponting is made to wait, tries to swat it down leg but misses
Benn to Watson, no run leans forward to defend a flighted delivery on the off and middle line
Benn to Watson, FOUR runs he goes right back to cut a short-of-length delivery outside off through backward point
Benn to Watson, no run on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
Benn to Watson, 1 run leans forward to jab a full delivery bat and pad to the leg side
Benn to Ponting, no run stretches across to push to covers
Benn to Ponting, no run flighted full outside off, steered to point
Powell to Watson, no run length delivery outside off stump, Watson is beaten as he tries to chop it down to third man.
Powell to Watson, 2 runs cuts in from short of length, towards middle, worked past square leg

Powell to Watson, 1 run coming in towards middle and, since Watson is on the middle and off stump guard, he can work it behind square leg. Anything on the middle or even middle and off, he turns it to the leg side
Powell to Ponting, no run yorker on the middle stump line, jabbed down the track. That will be a good ball to bowl to Watson
Powell to Ponting, 1 run
Powell to Watson, 1 run short of length, just outside off and that length allows him to dab it right of midwicket
Benn to Watson, no run goes right back to defend to the on side
Benn to Watson, 2 runs a tad short in length and Watson goes back to pull to wide long-on
Benn to Watson, FOUR runs leans forward to defend a delivery turning away from him and it runs off the outer edge past Bravo at short third man.
Benn to Watson, no run goes back to defend a delivery outside off
Benn to Watson, 2 runs goes back to push at a spinning delivery and it runs off the outside edge
Benn to Watson, no run stretches forward to defend
Powell to Ponting, no run full pitched outside off, driven to covers
Powell to Ponting, 1 run shuffles towards off and tucks a slower one to square leg
Powell to Watson, no run change of pace again, full and well outside off, mistimes a drive back to the bowler
Powell to Watson, (no ball) yet another slower one, dabbed to point region. No ball, though. Free hit coming up.
Powell to Watson, FOUR runs he moved to the off stump, as he did so often in the IPL games, and muscled a fullish delivery from outside off to midwicket boundary.
Powell to Watson, 1 run short one and pulled past square leg. He didn't middle that.
Powell to Ponting, FOUR runs Too many slower ones in a row and Ponting picked this one up, waited before square driving it to cover point boundary
Benn to Watson, no run flighted full outside off stump, cut to short third man
Benn to Watson, FOUR runs this time he cuts through covers. And will pick up a boundary. He is hanging on the back foot, looking for every opportunity to cut
Benn to Watson, no run fuller, defended down the track
Benn to Watson, FOUR runs There you go. Again presses back and goes for the cut shot. Benn is pinging the short of length too often. Perhaps, he is wary of Watson charging out
Benn to Watson, FOUR runs Same delivery. Same result. And Watson raises his bat to acknowledge the cheers for his fifty.
Benn to Watson, 1 run on the leg and middle, full, tickled to square leg
Bravo to Watson, 1 run just outside the off stump, cut late to third man
Bravo to Ponting, no run short in length, around the off stump, Ponting gets close to the line and pushes it cautiously to covers

Bravo to Ponting, FOUR runs Short in length and Ponting goes for his favourite pull and it races along the turft to deep square leg and Powell was there to field but he let it slip through his fingers. Made a complete mess of that one.
Bravo to Ponting, no run
Bravo to Ponting, no run on the off stump line, pushed to covers
Bravo to Ponting, no run full pitched and driven down the track
Sammy to Watson, 1 run full and just outside off stump, Watson opens the bat- face and runs it to third man

Sammy to Ponting, no run leans forward to defend a length delivery to off side

Bravo to Watson, no run on a length, outside off, defended to the off side
Bravo to Watson, 1 run short of length, outside off, punched to sweeper cover

Bravo to Ponting, 1 run run out chance missed by Sammy, It was dabbed close on the off side and they set for a risky run, Sammy swooped on the ball and fired in a throw but missed. Watson was not even in the frame
Bravo to Watson, 1 run clips a full delivery from middle and off to deep square leg
Bravo to Ponting, no run rushing through straight in the off stump channel and Ponting is beaten, trying to dab it to third man

Edwards to Ponting, no run off cutter on the off stump, steered to point
Edwards to Ponting, no run leans forward to drive to backward point. Sammy has a shy at the non-striker's end, can't find the stumps again but Watson was inside the crease this time
Edwards to Ponting, no run the slow bouncer and Ponting was early into the pull shot and it bounded off the arm on to his helmet

Bravo to Watson, 2 leg byes drifts down leg and it runs off the pad to fine leg. Did he get some bat on it

Gayle to Ponting, 3 runs on the back foot and cut past point. They will pick up three runs for the effort

Gayle to Watson, FOUR runs Maiden ODI hundred for Watson. Is he delighted or what? He reaches the landmark with a ferocious slog sweep. Great moment for Watto. He raised his bat and let out a cry of joy
Gayle to Watson, no run leans forward to defend
Gayle to Watson, 1 run fullish, turned past square leg

Gayle to Watson, 1 run comes down the track,. almost yorks himself but digs it out to long-off

Sammy to Watson, FOUR runs dropped by Benn. Watson smashed a full delivery across the line to deep midwicket and Benn moved to his right but couldn't hold to a fairly regulation catch

Sammy to Symonds, 1 run And Spain have won the Euro 2008. meanwhile back in cricket, a single down to long-on where Chanders fields

Bravo to Symonds, 1 run What a try from Bravo. Symonds had top edged a pull towards square leg and Bravo sprinted across and dived full stretch but couldn't reach it.

Marshall to Clarke, no run full and outside off, driven to covers
Marshall to Clarke, 5 wide Australia win by 7 wickets. Australia lead the five-match series 3-0. Wide down the leg side and Ramdin couldn't get across in time. Clinical performance from the Aussies.
That's it from us. Good bye and good luck
Stay on for the quotes from the post-match ceremony
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 57 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
